summary:
The Nintendo GameCube is a video game console released in 2001, replacing the Nintendo 64. It competed with the PlayStation 2, Dreamcast, and Xbox. Developed with ArtX, it introduced Nintendo's optical disc format, offering better graphics and sound than cartridges.

The GameCube focused solely on gaming, lacking multimedia capabilities like DVD playback. It had limited online gaming and unique features like connecting to the Game Boy Advance for enhanced gameplay. Despite critical acclaim for its games and controller, it was criticized for lacking third-party support and multimedia functions. Some popular titles include *Super Mario Sunshine* and *The Legend of Zelda: The Wind Waker*.
title: GameCube
